instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all patients who had their first CT study after January 1, 2023.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?patientName (MIN(?studyDate) AS ?firstStudyDate)
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?study dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
}
GROUP BY ?patientName
HAVING (MIN(xsd:date(?studyDate)) > xsd:date("2023-01-01"))
ORDER BY ?firstStudyDate

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Calculate the average time between consecutive CT studies for each patient.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?patientName (AVG(?daysBetween) AS ?avgDaysBetween)
WHERE {
  {
    SELECT ?patientName ?studyDate1 ?studyDate2 
           (xsd:integer(xsd:date(?studyDate2)) - xsd:integer(xsd:date(?studyDate1)) AS ?daysBetween)
    WHERE {
      ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
      ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
      ?study1 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
      ?study1 dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate1 .
      ?series1 dcm:isSeriesOf ?study1 .
      ?series1 dcm:Modality "CT" .
      ?study2 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
      ?study2 dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate2 .
      ?series2 dcm:isSeriesOf ?study2 .
      ?series2 dcm:Modality "CT" .
      FILTER(xsd:date(?studyDate1) < xsd:date(?studyDate2))
      FILTER NOT EXISTS {
        ?study3 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
        ?study3 dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate3 .
        ?series3 dcm:isSeriesOf ?study3 .
        ?series3 dcm:Modality "CT" .
        FILTER(xsd:date(?studyDate1) < xsd:date(?studyDate3) && xsd:date(?studyDate3) < xsd:date(?studyDate2))
      }
    }
  }
}
GROUP BY ?patientName
ORDER BY ?patientName

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all CT studies performed on the same day as another CT study for the same patient.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?patientName ?studyDate ?study1 ?study2
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?study1 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?study1 dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  ?series1 dcm:isSeriesOf ?study1 .
  ?series1 dcm:Modality "CT" .
  ?study2 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?study2 dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  ?series2 dcm:isSeriesOf ?study2 .
  ?series2 dcm:Modality "CT" .
  FILTER(?study1 != ?study2)
}
ORDER BY ?patientName ?studyDate

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find the busiest hour of the day for performing CT studies.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?hour (COUNT(?study) AS ?studyCount)
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyTime ?studyTime .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  BIND(SUBSTR(?studyTime, 1, 2) AS ?hour)
}
GROUP BY ?hour
ORDER BY DESC(?studyCount)
LIMIT 1

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all CT studies performed within 30 days of a previous CT study for the same patient.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?patientName ?studyDate1 ?studyDate2 
       (xsd:integer(xsd:date(?studyDate2)) - xsd:integer(xsd:date(?studyDate1)) AS ?daysBetween)
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?study1 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?study1 dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate1 .
  ?series1 dcm:isSeriesOf ?study1 .
  ?series1 dcm:Modality "CT" .
  ?study2 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?study2 dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate2 .
  ?series2 dcm:isSeriesOf ?study2 .
  ?series2 dcm:Modality "CT" .
  FILTER(xsd:date(?studyDate1) < xsd:date(?studyDate2))
  FILTER(xsd:integer(xsd:date(?studyDate2)) - xsd:integer(xsd:date(?studyDate1)) <= 30)
}
ORDER BY ?patientName ?studyDate1 ?studyDate2

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Calculate the average age of patients for each month of CT studies in 2023.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?month (AVG(xsd:integer(REPLACE(?patientsAge, "Y", ""))) AS ?avgAge)
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  ?study dcm:PatientsAge ?patientsAge .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "2023"))
  BIND(SUBSTR(?studyDate, 6, 2) AS ?month)
}
GROUP BY ?month
ORDER BY ?month

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all patients who had more than 3 CT studies in a single month.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?patientName ?yearMonth (COUNT(?study) AS ?studyCount)
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?study dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  BIND(SUBSTR(?studyDate, 0, 8) AS ?yearMonth)
}
GROUP BY ?patientName ?yearMonth
HAVING (COUNT(?study) > 3)
ORDER BY ?patientName ?yearMonth

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all CT studies performed during business hours (9 AM to 5 PM) on weekdays.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?study ?studyDate ?studyTime
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  ?study dcm:StudyTime ?studyTime .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  FILTER(
    !CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "Saturday") && 
    !CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "Sunday") &&
    xsd:time(?studyTime) >= xsd:time("09:00:00") && 
    xsd:time(?studyTime) <= xsd:time("17:00:00")
  )
}
ORDER BY ?studyDate ?studyTime

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Calculate the average duration of CT studies (time between first and last image acquisition).
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?study (MIN(?acquisitionTime) AS ?firstAcquisition) 
       (MAX(?acquisitionTime) AS ?lastAcquisition)
       (xsd:integer(xsd:time(MAX(?acquisitionTime))) - xsd:integer(xsd:time(MIN(?acquisitionTime))) AS ?durationSeconds)
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  ?image dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?image dcm:AcquisitionTime ?acquisitionTime .
}
GROUP BY ?study
ORDER BY ?study

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Count the number of CT studies for each patient in 2023 with their patient information.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .

  ?patient dcm:PatientID ?patientID .
  ?study dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .

}
GROUP BY ?patientName ?patientID
ORDER BY DESC(?studyCount)

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all CT images with KVP greater than 120 and SliceThickness less than 2mm.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?ctimage ?kvp ?sliceThickness
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  ?ctimage rdf:type dcm:Image .
  ?ctimage dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?ctimage dcm:KVP ?kvp .
  ?ctimage dcm:SliceThickness ?sliceThickness .
  FILTER(xsd:float(?kvp) > 120 && xsd:float(?sliceThickness) < 2)
}
ORDER BY ?kvp ?sliceThickness

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all CT studies performed in 2023 for patients over 65 years old.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?study ?studyDate ?patientName ?patientsAge
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?study dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  ?study dcm:PatientsAge ?patientsAge .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "2023") && xsd:integer(REPLACE(?patientsAge, "Y", "")) > 65)
}
ORDER BY ?studyDate

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all CT images with specific ImageType containing 'ORIGINAL' and RescaleType 'HU'.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?ctimage ?imageType ?rescaleType
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  ?ctimage rdf:type dcm:Image .
  ?ctimage dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?ctimage dcm:ImageType ?imageType .
  ?ctimage dcm:RescaleType ?rescaleType .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(?imageType, "ORIGINAL") && ?rescaleType = "HU")
}

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all CT studies performed by Dr. Smith for patients with 'Johnson' in their name.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?study ?studyDate ?patientName ?performingPhysician
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?study dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  ?series dcm:PerformingPhysiciansName ?performingPhysician .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(?patientName, "Johnson") && CONTAINS(?performingPhysician, "Smith"))
}
ORDER BY ?studyDate

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all CT studies performed in the morning (before noon) on weekdays.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?study ?studyDate ?studyTime
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  ?study dcm:StudyTime ?studyTime .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  FILTER(
    !CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "Saturday") && 
    !CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "Sunday") &&
    xsd:time(?studyTime) >= xsd:time("06:00:00") && 
    xsd:time(?studyTime) < xsd:time("12:00:00")
  )
}
ORDER BY ?studyDate ?studyTime

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all CT images with WindowCenter between 30 and 50 and WindowWidth between 80 and 100.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?ctimage ?windowCenter ?windowWidth
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  ?ctimage rdf:type dcm:Image .
  ?ctimage dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?ctimage dcm:WindowCenter ?windowCenter .
  ?ctimage dcm:WindowWidth ?windowWidth .
  FILTER(
    xsd:float(?windowCenter) >= 30 && xsd:float(?windowCenter) <= 50 && 
    xsd:float(?windowWidth) >= 80 && xsd:float(?windowWidth) <= 100
  )
}
ORDER BY ?windowCenter ?windowWidth

PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT DISTINCT ?patientName
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?study1 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?study1 dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate1 .
  ?series1 dcm:isSeriesOf ?study1 .
  ?series1 dcm:Modality "CT" .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate1), "2023"))
  ?study2 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?study2 dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate2 .
  ?series2 dcm:isSeriesOf ?study2 .
  ?series2 dcm:Modality "MRI" .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate2), "2023"))
}

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all CT studies performed in 2023 for male patients over 60 years old.

  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?patient dcm:PatientSex ?patientSex .
  ?study dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  ?study dcm:PatientsAge ?patientsAge .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  FILTER(

    ?patientSex = "M" && 
    xsd:integer(REPLACE(?patientsAge, "Y", "")) > 60
  )
}
ORDER BY ?studyDate

question: Find all patients born after January 1, 1980.

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: How many studies does each patient have?
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?patientName (COUNT(?study) AS ?studyCount)
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?study dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
}
GROUP BY ?patientName
ORDER BY DESC(?studyCount)

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all series performed in 2023.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?series ?seriesDate
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:SeriesDate ?seriesDate .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(STR(?seriesDate), "2023"))
}
ORDER BY ?seriesDate

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: How many images does each series have?
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?series (COUNT(?image) AS ?imageCount)
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:containsImage ?image .
}
GROUP BY ?series
ORDER BY DESC(?imageCount)

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Which series were performed by Dr. Smith?
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?series ?performingPhysician
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:PerformingPhysiciansName ?performingPhysician .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(?performingPhysician, "Smith"))
}

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find series with modality 'CT' performed in January 2023.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?series ?seriesDate
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  ?series dcm:SeriesDate ?seriesDate .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(STR(?seriesDate), "2023-01"))
}
ORDER BY ?seriesDate

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Count the number of series by modality.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?modality (COUNT(?series) AS ?seriesCount)
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:Modality ?modality .
}
GROUP BY ?modality
ORDER BY DESC(?seriesCount)

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Which series have the most images?
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?series ?modality (COUNT(?image) AS ?imageCount)
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:Modality ?modality .
  ?series dcm:containsImage ?image .
}
GROUP BY ?series ?modality
ORDER BY DESC(?imageCount)
LIMIT 10

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: List series with their study dates.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?series ?seriesDate ?studyDate
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:SeriesDate ?seriesDate .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
}
ORDER BY ?studyDate ?seriesDate

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find CT series for patient 'John Doe'.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?series ?seriesDate
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName "John Doe" .
  ?study dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  OPTIONAL { ?series dcm:SeriesDate ?seriesDate . }
}
ORDER BY ?seriesDate

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Count the number of series per study.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?studyID (COUNT(?series) AS ?seriesCount)
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyID ?studyID .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
}
GROUP BY ?studyID
ORDER BY DESC(?seriesCount)

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find series with modality 'CT' and more than 100 images.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?series (COUNT(?image) AS ?imageCount)
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  ?series dcm:containsImage ?image .
}
GROUP BY ?series
HAVING (COUNT(?image) > 100)
ORDER BY DESC(?imageCount)

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find series performed in the last 6 months.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?series ?seriesDate
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:SeriesDate ?seriesDate .
  FILTER(xsd:date(?seriesDate) > xsd:date("2023-10-17"))
}
ORDER BY DESC(?seriesDate)

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Which series have images with KVP values greater than 120?
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT DISTINCT ?series ?modality
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:Modality ?modality .
  ?series dcm:containsImage ?image .
  ?image dcm:KVP ?kvp .
  FILTER(xsd:float(?kvp) > 120)
}

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find series with modality 'CT' performed on patients older than 60.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?series ?patientName ?patientsAge
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?study dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?study dcm:PatientsAge ?patientsAge .
  FILTER(xsd:integer(REPLACE(?patientsAge, "Y", "")) > 60)
}

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find series with modality 'CT' and KVP values between 100 and 140.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT DISTINCT ?series ?kvp
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  ?series dcm:containsImage ?image .
  ?image dcm:KVP ?kvp .
  FILTER(xsd:float(?kvp) >= 100 && xsd:float(?kvp) <= 140)
}
ORDER BY ?kvp

  ?series dcm:Modality ?modality .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?study dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
}
GROUP BY ?patientName ?modality
ORDER BY ?patientName DESC(?seriesCount)

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find CT images for patient 'John Doe' with specific KVP values.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?image ?kvp
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName "John Doe" .
  ?study dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?image dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?image rdf:type dcm:ImageOfCTImage .
  ?image dcm:KVP ?kvp .
  FILTER(xsd:float(?kvp) > 120)
}

PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?kvpRange ?rescaleType (COUNT(?image) AS ?imageCount)
WHERE {
  ?image rdf:type dcm:ImageOfCTImage .
  ?image dcm:KVP ?kvp .

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Calculate the percentage of CT images with each PatientOrientation by study year.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?studyYear ?patientOrientation (COUNT(?image) AS ?imageCount) 
       (100 * COUNT(?image) / ?totalYearImages AS ?percentage)
WHERE {
  {
    SELECT ?studyYear (COUNT(?allImages) AS ?totalYearImages)
    WHERE {
      ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
      ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
      BIND(SUBSTR(?studyDate, 0, 4) AS ?studyYear)
      ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
      ?allImages dcm:isImageOf ?series .
      ?allImages rdf:type dcm:ImageOfCTImage .
      ?allImages dcm:PatientOrientation ?po .
    }
    GROUP BY ?studyYear
  }
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  BIND(SUBSTR(?studyDate, 0, 4) AS ?studyYear)
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?image dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?image rdf:type dcm:ImageOfCTImage .
  ?image dcm:PatientOrientation ?patientOrientation .
}
GROUP BY ?studyYear ?patientOrientation ?totalYearImages
ORDER BY ?studyYear ?patientOrientation

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find the distribution of KVP values for CT images by performing physician.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?performingPhysician ?kvpRange (COUNT(?image) AS ?imageCount)
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:PerformingPhysiciansName ?performingPhysician .
  ?image dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?image rdf:type dcm:ImageOfCTImage .
  ?image dcm:KVP ?kvp .
  BIND(
    IF(xsd:float(?kvp) < 100, "Low (<100)",
      IF(xsd:float(?kvp) < 120, "Medium (100-120)", "High (>120)")
    ) AS ?kvpRange
  )
}
GROUP BY ?performingPhysician ?kvpRange
ORDER BY ?performingPhysician ?kvpRange

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Calculate the average EnergyWeightingFactor for CT images by study time of day.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?timeOfDay (AVG(xsd:float(?energyWeightingFactor)) AS ?avgEWF)
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyTime ?studyTime .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?image dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?image rdf:type dcm:ImageOfCTImage .
  ?image dcm:EnergyWeightingFactor ?energyWeightingFactor .
  BIND(
    IF(xsd:time(?studyTime) < xsd:time("08:00:00"), "Early Morning",
      IF(xsd:time(?studyTime) < xsd:time("12:00:00"), "Morning",
        IF(xsd:time(?studyTime) < xsd:time("17:00:00"), "Afternoon", "Evening")
      )
    ) AS ?timeOfDay
  )
}
GROUP BY ?timeOfDay
ORDER BY ?timeOfDay

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find the most common combination of HighBit and BitsAllocated for CT images by patient age.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?ageGroup ?highBit ?bitsAllocated (COUNT(?image) AS ?imageCount)
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:PatientsAge ?patientsAge .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?image dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?image rdf:type dcm:ImageOfCTImage .
  ?image dcm:HighBit ?highBit .
  ?image dcm:BitsAllocated ?bitsAllocated .
  BIND(
    IF(xsd:integer(REPLACE(?patientsAge, "Y", "")) < 18, "Child",
      IF(xsd:integer(REPLACE(?patientsAge, "Y", "")) < 65, "Adult", "Senior")
    ) AS ?ageGroup
  )
}
GROUP BY ?ageGroup ?highBit ?bitsAllocated
ORDER BY ?ageGroup DESC(?imageCount)

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Calculate the percentage of CT images with each ImageType by patient gender.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?patientSex ?imageType (COUNT(?image) AS ?imageCount) 
       (100 * COUNT(?image) / ?totalGenderImages AS ?percentage)
WHERE {
  {
    SELECT ?patientSex (COUNT(?allImages) AS ?totalGenderImages)
    WHERE {
      ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
      ?patient dcm:PatientSex ?patientSex .
      ?study dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
      ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
      ?allImages dcm:isImageOf ?series .
      ?allImages rdf:type dcm:ImageOfCTImage .
      ?allImages dcm:ImageType ?it .
    }
    GROUP BY ?patientSex
  }
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientSex ?patientSex .
  ?study dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?image dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?image rdf:type dcm:ImageOfCTImage .
  ?image dcm:ImageType ?imageType .
}
GROUP BY ?patientSex ?imageType ?totalGenderImages
ORDER BY ?patientSex ?imageType

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Count the number of studies performed each day of the week.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?dayOfWeek (COUNT(?study) AS ?studyCount)
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  BIND(
    IF(CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "Monday"), "Monday",
      IF(CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "Tuesday"), "Tuesday",
        IF(CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "Wednesday"), "Wednesday",
          IF(CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "Thursday"), "Thursday",
            IF(CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "Friday"), "Friday",
              IF(CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "Saturday"), "Saturday", "Sunday")
            )
          )
        )
      )
    ) AS ?dayOfWeek
  )
}
GROUP BY ?dayOfWeek
ORDER BY CASE ?dayOfWeek
  WHEN "Monday" THEN 1
  WHEN "Tuesday" THEN 2
  WHEN "Wednesday" THEN 3
  WHEN "Thursday" THEN 4
  WHEN "Friday" THEN 5
  WHEN "Saturday" THEN 6
  WHEN "Sunday" THEN 7
END

  FILTER(CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate2), "2023"))
}

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find the time gap between consecutive studies for each patient.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?patientName ?studyDate1 ?studyDate2 
       (xsd:integer(xsd:date(?studyDate2)) - xsd:integer(xsd:date(?studyDate1)) AS ?daysBetween)
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?study1 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?study1 dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate1 .
  ?study2 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?study2 dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate2 .
  FILTER(xsd:date(?studyDate1) < xsd:date(?studyDate2))
  FILTER NOT EXISTS {
    ?study3 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
    ?study3 dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate3 .
    FILTER(xsd:date(?studyDate1) < xsd:date(?studyDate3) && xsd:date(?studyDate3) < xsd:date(?studyDate2))
  }
}
ORDER BY ?patientName ?studyDate1

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all studies performed during business hours (9 AM to 5 PM) on weekdays.

PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  ?study dcm:StudyTime ?studyTime .
  FILTER(
    !CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "Saturday") && 
    !CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "Sunday") &&
    xsd:time(?studyTime) >= xsd:time("09:00:00") && 
    xsd:time(?studyTime) <= xsd:time("17:00:00")
  )
}
ORDER BY ?studyDate ?studyTime

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Calculate the average duration of studies (time between first and last image acquisition).
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?study (MIN(?acquisitionTime) AS ?firstAcquisition) 
       (MAX(?acquisitionTime) AS ?lastAcquisition)
       (xsd:integer(xsd:time(MAX(?acquisitionTime))) - xsd:integer(xsd:time(MIN(?acquisitionTime))) AS ?durationSeconds)
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?image dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?image dcm:AcquisitionTime ?acquisitionTime .
}
GROUP BY ?study
ORDER BY ?study

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Which series have the most images?

question: Find CT images with specific RescaleType for series performed by Dr. Smith.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?image ?rescaleType ?performingPhysician
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:PerformingPhysiciansName ?performingPhysician .
  ?image dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?image rdf:type dcm:ImageOfCTImage .
  ?image dcm:RescaleType ?rescaleType .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(?performingPhysician, "Smith") && ?rescaleType = "HU")
}

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: List CT images with specific PatientOrientation for studies with RetrieveAETitle containing 'PACS'.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?image ?patientOrientation ?retrieveAETitle
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:RetrieveAETitle ?retrieveAETitle .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?image dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?image rdf:type dcm:ImageOfCTImage .
  ?image dcm:PatientOrientation ?patientOrientation .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(?retrieveAETitle, "PACS") && CONTAINS(?patientOrientation, "A"))
}

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find CT images with specific PhotometricInterpretation for patients weighing more than 70 kg.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?image ?photometricInterpretation ?patientWeight
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:PatientWeight ?patientWeight .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?image dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?image rdf:type dcm:ImageOfCTImage .
  ?image dcm:PhotometricInterpretation ?photometricInterpretation .
  FILTER(xsd:float(REPLACE(?patientWeight, " kg", "")) > 70 && ?photometricInterpretation = "MONOCHROME2")
}

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: List CT images with specific SamplesPerPixel values for studies performed in January 2023.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?image ?samplesPerPixel ?studyDate
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?image dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?image rdf:type dcm:ImageOfCTImage .
  ?image dcm:SamplesPerPixel ?samplesPerPixel .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "2023-01") && ?samplesPerPixel = "1")
}
ORDER BY ?studyDate

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find CT images with specific KVP, ImageType, and RescaleType.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?image ?kvp ?imageType ?rescaleType
WHERE {
  ?image rdf:type dcm:ImageOfCTImage .
  ?image dcm:KVP ?kvp .
  ?image dcm:ImageType ?imageType .
  ?image dcm:RescaleType ?rescaleType .
  FILTER(xsd:float(?kvp) > 120 && CONTAINS(?imageType, "ORIGINAL") && ?rescaleType = "HU")
}

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: List CT images with specific EnergyWeightingFactor, HighBit, and SamplesPerPixel.

PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>

}

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Count the number of CT images by KVP value.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?kvp (COUNT(?image) AS ?imageCount)
WHERE {
  ?image rdf:type dcm:ImageOfCTImage .
  ?image dcm:KVP ?kvp .

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find the average KVP value for CT images by patient.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?patientName (AVG(xsd:float(?kvp)) AS ?avgKVP)
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?study dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?image dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?image rdf:type dcm:ImageOfCTImage .
  ?image dcm:KVP ?kvp .
}
GROUP BY ?patientName
ORDER BY DESC(?avgKVP)

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find the average EnergyWeightingFactor for CT images by patient age group.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?ageGroup (AVG(xsd:float(?energyWeightingFactor)) AS ?avgEnergyWeightingFactor)
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:PatientsAge ?patientsAge .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?image dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?image rdf:type dcm:ImageOfCTImage .
  ?image dcm:EnergyWeightingFactor ?energyWeightingFactor .
  BIND(
    IF(xsd:integer(REPLACE(?patientsAge, "Y", "")) < 18, "Child",
      IF(xsd:integer(REPLACE(?patientsAge, "Y", "")) < 65, "Adult", "Senior")
    ) AS ?ageGroup
  )
}
GROUP BY ?ageGroup
ORDER BY ?ageGroup

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Calculate the minimum, maximum, and average EnergyWeightingFactor for CT images.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>

}

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find the distribution of RescaleType values for CT images with different KVP ranges.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?kvpRange ?rescaleType (COUNT(?image) AS ?imageCount)
WHERE {
  ?image rdf:type dcm:ImageOfCTImage .
  ?image dcm:KVP ?kvp .
  ?image dcm:RescaleType ?rescaleType .
  BIND(
    IF(xsd:float(?kvp) < 100, "Low (<100)",
      IF(xsd:float(?kvp) < 120, "Medium (100-120)", "High (>120)")
    ) AS ?kvpRange
  )
}
GROUP BY ?kvpRange ?rescaleType
ORDER BY ?kvpRange DESC(?imageCount)

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find the most common ImageType for CT images by patient weight range.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?weightRange ?imageType (COUNT(?image) AS ?imageCount)
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:PatientWeight ?patientWeight .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?image dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?image rdf:type dcm:ImageOfCTImage .
  ?image dcm:ImageType ?imageType .
  BIND(
    IF(xsd:float(REPLACE(?patientWeight, " kg", "")) < 50, "Light (<50kg)",
      IF(xsd:float(REPLACE(?patientWeight, " kg", "")) < 80, "Medium (50-80kg)", "Heavy (>80kg)")
    ) AS ?weightRange
  )
}
GROUP BY ?weightRange ?imageType
ORDER BY ?weightRange DESC(?imageCount)

question: Find all patients with their name and birth date after January 1, 1980.

PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all female patients with their age calculated from birth date.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?patient ?patientName ?birthDate 
       (YEAR(NOW()) - YEAR(xsd:date(?birthDate)) - 
        IF(MONTH(NOW()) < MONTH(xsd:date(?birthDate)) || 
           (MONTH(NOW()) = MONTH(xsd:date(?birthDate)) && 
            DAY(NOW()) < DAY(xsd:date(?birthDate))), 1, 0) AS ?age)
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?patient dcm:PatientBirthDate ?birthDate .
  ?patient dcm:PatientSex ?patientSex .
  FILTER(?patientSex = "F")
}
ORDER BY ?age

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all patients with their BMI calculated from weight and height.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?patient ?patientName ?patientWeight ?patientSize 
       (xsd:float(?patientWeight) / (xsd:float(?patientSize) * xsd:float(?patientSize)) AS ?bmi)
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?patient dcm:PatientWeight ?patientWeight .
  ?patient dcm:PatientSize ?patientSize .
}
ORDER BY ?bmi

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all patients with smoking status of 'YES' and calculate their average age.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT (AVG(?age) AS ?averageAge)
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:SmokingStatus "YES" .
  ?patient dcm:PatientBirthDate ?birthDate .
  BIND(YEAR(NOW()) - YEAR(xsd:date(?birthDate)) - 
       IF(MONTH(NOW()) < MONTH(xsd:date(?birthDate)) || 
          (MONTH(NOW()) = MONTH(xsd:date(?birthDate)) && 
           DAY(NOW()) < DAY(xsd:date(?birthDate))), 1, 0) AS ?age)
}

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all patients with occupation containing 'Engineer' or 'Developer'.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?patient ?patientName ?occupation
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?patient dcm:Occupation ?occupation .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(LCASE(?occupation), "engineer") || CONTAINS(LCASE(?occupation), "developer"))
}
ORDER BY ?patientName

question: Find all patients with birth dates in the 1970s.

question: Find all patients with specific ethnic groups and count them.

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all patients with birth dates on a specific day of the week (Monday).
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?patient ?patientName ?birthDate
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?patient dcm:PatientBirthDate ?birthDate .
  BIND(WEEKDAY(xsd:date(?birthDate)) AS ?dayOfWeek)
  FILTER(?dayOfWeek = 0)  # 0 is Monday in WEEKDAY function
}
ORDER BY ?birthDate

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all patients with a specific BMI range (25-30) indicating overweight.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?patient ?patientName ?bmi
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?patient dcm:PatientWeight ?patientWeight .
  ?patient dcm:PatientSize ?patientSize .
  BIND(xsd:float(?patientWeight) / (xsd:float(?patientSize) * xsd:float(?patientSize)) AS ?bmi)
  FILTER(?bmi >= 25.0 && ?bmi < 30.0)
}
ORDER BY ?bmi

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all patients with specific occupation categories and calculate their average weight.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?occupationCategory (AVG(xsd:float(?patientWeight)) AS ?averageWeight)
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:Occupation ?occupation .
  ?patient dcm:PatientWeight ?patientWeight .
  BIND(
    IF(CONTAINS(LCASE(?occupation), "engineer") || CONTAINS(LCASE(?occupation), "developer"), "Technical",
      IF(CONTAINS(LCASE(?occupation), "doctor") || CONTAINS(LCASE(?occupation), "nurse"), "Medical",
        IF(CONTAINS(LCASE(?occupation), "teacher") || CONTAINS(LCASE(?occupation), "professor"), "Education",
          "Other"))) AS ?occupationCategory)
}
GROUP BY ?occupationCategory
ORDER BY ?occupationCategory

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all patients with addresses in specific regions and count them.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?region (COUNT(?patient) AS ?patientCount)
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientAddress ?patientAddress .
  BIND(
    IF(CONTAINS(?patientAddress, "CA") || CONTAINS(?patientAddress, "California"), "West",
      IF(CONTAINS(?patientAddress, "NY") || CONTAINS(?patientAddress, "New York"), "East",
        IF(CONTAINS(?patientAddress, "TX") || CONTAINS(?patientAddress, "Texas"), "South",
          IF(CONTAINS(?patientAddress, "IL") || CONTAINS(?patientAddress, "Illinois"), "Midwest",
            "Other")))) AS ?region)
}
GROUP BY ?region
ORDER BY DESC(?patientCount)

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all studies performed in the morning (between 8 AM and 12 PM) and their patient information.

PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?study ?studyDate ?studyTime ?patientName
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  ?study dcm:StudyTime ?studyTime .
  ?study dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  FILTER(xsd:time(?studyTime) >= xsd:time("08:00:00") && xsd:time(?studyTime) < xsd:time("12:00:00"))
}
ORDER BY ?studyDate ?studyTime

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all studies with a specific referring physician and count them by month in 2023.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?month (COUNT(?study) AS ?studyCount)
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  ?study dcm:ReferringPhysicianName ?referringPhysician .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "2023") && CONTAINS(?referringPhysician, "Smith"))
  BIND(SUBSTR(?studyDate, 6, 2) AS ?month)
}
GROUP BY ?month
ORDER BY ?month

}

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all studies performed on weekends in 2023.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?study ?studyDate
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "2023"))

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all studies performed in the first quarter of 2023 and count them by referring physician.
sparql:

PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Calculate the average time between consecutive studies for each patient in 2023.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?patientName (AVG(?daysBetween) AS ?avgDaysBetween)
WHERE {
  {
    SELECT ?patientName ?studyDate1 ?studyDate2 
           (xsd:integer(xsd:date(?studyDate2)) - xsd:integer(xsd:date(?studyDate1)) AS ?daysBetween)
    WHERE {
      ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
      ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
      ?study1 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
      ?study1 dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate1 .
      ?study2 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
      ?study2 dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate2 .
      FILTER(
        CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate1), "2023") && 
        CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate2), "2023") && 
        xsd:date(?studyDate1) < xsd:date(?studyDate2)
      )
      FILTER NOT EXISTS {
        ?study3 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
        ?study3 dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate3 .
        FILTER(
          CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate3), "2023") && 
          xsd:date(?studyDate1) < xsd:date(?studyDate3) && 
          xsd:date(?studyDate3) < xsd:date(?studyDate2)
        )
      }
    }
  }
}
GROUP BY ?patientName
HAVING (AVG(?daysBetween) > 0)
ORDER BY ?avgDaysBetween

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all studies with patient age in specific ranges and count them.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?ageGroup (COUNT(?study) AS ?studyCount)
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:PatientsAge ?patientsAge .
  BIND(
    IF(xsd:integer(REPLACE(?patientsAge, "Y", "")) < 18, "Pediatric",
      IF(xsd:integer(REPLACE(?patientsAge, "Y", "")) < 65, "Adult",
        "Elderly")) AS ?ageGroup
  )
}
GROUP BY ?ageGroup
ORDER BY ?ageGroup

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all studies performed during business hours (9 AM to 5 PM) on weekdays in 2023.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?study ?studyDate ?studyTime
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  ?study dcm:StudyTime ?studyTime .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "2023"))
  BIND(WEEKDAY(xsd:date(?studyDate)) AS ?dayOfWeek)
  FILTER(
    ?dayOfWeek >= 0 && ?dayOfWeek <= 4 &&  # Weekdays (Monday to Friday)
    xsd:time(?studyTime) >= xsd:time("09:00:00") && 
    xsd:time(?studyTime) <= xsd:time("17:00:00")
  )
}
ORDER BY ?studyDate ?studyTime

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all studies with specific study descriptions and calculate the average patient age for each description.

PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?studyDescriptionCategory (AVG(xsd:integer(REPLACE(?patientsAge, "Y", ""))) AS ?avgAge)
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyDescription ?studyDescription .
  ?study dcm:PatientsAge ?patientsAge .
  BIND(
    IF(CONTAINS(LCASE(?studyDescription), "chest") || CONTAINS(LCASE(?studyDescription), "thorax"), "Chest",
      IF(CONTAINS(LCASE(?studyDescription), "abdomen"), "Abdomen",
        IF(CONTAINS(LCASE(?studyDescription), "head") || CONTAINS(LCASE(?studyDescription), "brain"), "Head",
          "Other"))) AS ?studyDescriptionCategory

}
GROUP BY ?studyDescriptionCategory
ORDER BY ?studyDescriptionCategory

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all studies performed in 2023 and calculate the distribution by day of the week.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?dayName (COUNT(?study) AS ?studyCount)
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "2023"))
  BIND(WEEKDAY(xsd:date(?studyDate)) AS ?dayOfWeek)
  BIND(
    IF(?dayOfWeek = 0, "Monday",
      IF(?dayOfWeek = 1, "Tuesday",
        IF(?dayOfWeek = 2, "Wednesday",
          IF(?dayOfWeek = 3, "Thursday",
            IF(?dayOfWeek = 4, "Friday",
              IF(?dayOfWeek = 5, "Saturday", "Sunday")))))) AS ?dayName
  )
}
GROUP BY ?dayName
ORDER BY CASE ?dayName
  WHEN "Monday" THEN 1
  WHEN "Tuesday" THEN 2
  WHEN "Wednesday" THEN 3
  WHEN "Thursday" THEN 4
  WHEN "Friday" THEN 5
  WHEN "Saturday" THEN 6
  WHEN "Sunday" THEN 7
END

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all studies performed in 2023 and calculate the distribution by hour of the day.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?hour (COUNT(?study) AS ?studyCount)
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  ?study dcm:StudyTime ?studyTime .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "2023"))
  BIND(HOURS(xsd:time(?studyTime)) AS ?hour)
}
GROUP BY ?hour
ORDER BY ?hour

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all studies with accession numbers in specific formats and their study dates.

PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  FILTER(REGEX(?accessionNumber, "^[A-Z]{3}[0-9]{6}$"))
}

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all studies performed in specific date ranges and their referring physicians.
sparql:

WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  ?study dcm:ReferringPhysicianName ?referringPhysician .
  FILTER(

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all studies with specific time intervals between them for the same patient.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?patientName ?studyDate1 ?studyDate2 ?daysBetween
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?study1 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?study1 dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate1 .
  ?study2 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?study2 dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate2 .
  FILTER(xsd:date(?studyDate1) < xsd:date(?studyDate2))
  BIND(xsd:integer(xsd:date(?studyDate2)) - xsd:integer(xsd:date(?studyDate1)) AS ?daysBetween)
  FILTER(?daysBetween <= 30)  # Studies within 30 days of each other
  FILTER NOT EXISTS {
    ?study3 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
    ?study3 dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate3 .
    FILTER(
      xsd:date(?studyDate1) < xsd:date(?studyDate3) && 
      xsd:date(?studyDate3) < xsd:date(?studyDate2)
    )
  }
}
ORDER BY ?patientName ?studyDate1

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all studies with specific study descriptions and count them by month in 2023.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?month (COUNT(?study) AS ?studyCount)
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  ?study dcm:StudyDescription ?studyDescription .
  FILTER(
    CONTAINS(STR(?studyDate), "2023") && 
    (CONTAINS(LCASE(?studyDescription), "chest") || CONTAINS(LCASE(?studyDescription), "thorax"))
  )
  BIND(SUBSTR(?studyDate, 6, 2) AS ?month)
}
GROUP BY ?month
ORDER BY ?month

question: Find all series performed on weekends in 2023 and their modality.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?series ?seriesDate ?modality
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:SeriesDate ?seriesDate .
  ?series dcm:Modality ?modality .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(STR(?seriesDate), "2023"))
  BIND(WEEKDAY(xsd:date(?seriesDate)) AS ?dayOfWeek)

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all series with specific modalities and calculate the average time of day they were performed.
sparql:

PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?modality (AVG(HOURS(xsd:time(?seriesTime)) + MINUTES(xsd:time(?seriesTime)) / 60) AS ?avgTimeOfDay)
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:Modality ?modality .
  ?series dcm:SeriesTime ?seriesTime .
  FILTER(?modality IN ("CT", "MR", "US", "CR"))

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all series with specific performing physicians and their distribution by day of the week.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?dayName (COUNT(?series) AS ?seriesCount)
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:PerformingPhysiciansName ?performingPhysician .
  ?series dcm:SeriesDate ?seriesDate .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(?performingPhysician, "Smith"))
  BIND(WEEKDAY(xsd:date(?seriesDate)) AS ?dayOfWeek)
  BIND(
    IF(?dayOfWeek = 0, "Monday",
      IF(?dayOfWeek = 1, "Tuesday",
        IF(?dayOfWeek = 2, "Wednesday",
          IF(?dayOfWeek = 3, "Thursday",
            IF(?dayOfWeek = 4, "Friday",
              IF(?dayOfWeek = 5, "Saturday", "Sunday")))))) AS ?dayName
  )
}
GROUP BY ?dayName
ORDER BY CASE ?dayName
  WHEN "Monday" THEN 1
  WHEN "Tuesday" THEN 2
  WHEN "Wednesday" THEN 3
  WHEN "Thursday" THEN 4
  WHEN "Friday" THEN 5
  WHEN "Saturday" THEN 6
  WHEN "Sunday" THEN 7
END

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all series performed during business hours (9 AM to 5 PM) on weekdays in 2023.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?series ?seriesDate ?seriesTime
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:SeriesDate ?seriesDate .
  ?series dcm:SeriesTime ?seriesTime .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(STR(?seriesDate), "2023"))
  BIND(WEEKDAY(xsd:date(?seriesDate)) AS ?dayOfWeek)
  FILTER(
    ?dayOfWeek >= 0 && ?dayOfWeek <= 4 &&  # Weekdays (Monday to Friday)
    xsd:time(?seriesTime) >= xsd:time("09:00:00") && 
    xsd:time(?seriesTime) <= xsd:time("17:00:00")
  )
}
ORDER BY ?seriesDate ?seriesTime

question: Find all series performed in specific date ranges and their performing physicians.

PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?series ?seriesDate ?performingPhysician
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:SeriesDate ?seriesDate .
  ?series dcm:PerformingPhysiciansName ?performingPhysician .
  FILTER(
    xsd:date(?seriesDate) >= xsd:date("2023-06-01") && 
    xsd:date(?seriesDate) <= xsd:date("2023-06-30")
  )
}
ORDER BY ?seriesDate

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all series with specific body parts examined and calculate the distribution by patient gender.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?patientSex (COUNT(?series) AS ?seriesCount)
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:BodyPartExamined ?bodyPartExamined .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?study dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientSex ?patientSex .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(LCASE(?bodyPartExamined), "chest") || CONTAINS(LCASE(?bodyPartExamined), "thorax"))
}
GROUP BY ?patientSex
ORDER BY ?patientSex

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all images with specific window center ranges and count them by window width ranges.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?windowWidthRange (COUNT(?image) AS ?imageCount)
WHERE {
  ?image rdf:type dcm:Image .
  ?image dcm:WindowCenter ?windowCenter .
  ?image dcm:WindowWidth ?windowWidth .
  FILTER(xsd:float(?windowCenter) >= 30 && xsd:float(?windowCenter) <= 50)
  BIND(
    IF(xsd:float(?windowWidth) < 80, "Narrow",
      IF(xsd:float(?windowWidth) < 120, "Medium",
        "Wide")) AS ?windowWidthRange
  )
}
GROUP BY ?windowWidthRange
ORDER BY ?windowWidthRange

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all images with specific rescale slope values and count them by rescale intercept ranges.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?rescaleInterceptRange (COUNT(?image) AS ?imageCount)
WHERE {
  ?image rdf:type dcm:Image .
  ?image dcm:RescaleSlope ?rescaleSlope .
  ?image dcm:RescaleIntercept ?rescaleIntercept .
  FILTER(?rescaleSlope = "1")
  BIND(
    IF(xsd:integer(?rescaleIntercept) < -1000, "Very Low",
      IF(xsd:integer(?rescaleIntercept) < 0, "Low",
        "High")) AS ?rescaleInterceptRange
  )
}
GROUP BY ?rescaleInterceptRange
ORDER BY ?rescaleInterceptRange

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query

WHERE {
  ?image rdf:type dcm:Image .
  ?image dcm:SliceThickness ?sliceThickness .
  ?image dcm:SliceLocation ?sliceLocation .
  FILTER(xsd:float(?sliceThickness) < 2)
  BIND(
    IF(xsd:float(?sliceLocation) < 0, "Negative",
      IF(xsd:float(?sliceLocation) < 100, "Low",
        IF(xsd:float(?sliceLocation) < 200, "Medium",
          "High"))) AS ?sliceLocationRange
  )
}
GROUP BY ?sliceLocationRange
ORDER BY ?sliceLocationRange

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all images with specific pixel spacing values and calculate the average slice thickness.

PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?pixelSpacingCategory (AVG(xsd:float(?sliceThickness)) AS ?avgSliceThickness)
WHERE {
  ?image rdf:type dcm:Image .
  ?image dcm:PixelSpacing ?pixelSpacing .
  ?image dcm:SliceThickness ?sliceThickness .
  BIND(
    IF(CONTAINS(?pixelSpacing, "0.5"), "High Resolution",
      IF(CONTAINS(?pixelSpacing, "1.0"), "Standard Resolution",
        "Low Resolution")) AS ?pixelSpacingCategory
  )
}
GROUP BY ?pixelSpacingCategory
ORDER BY ?pixelSpacingCategory

}

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all CT images with specific KVP ranges and count them by exposure time ranges.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?exposureTimeRange (COUNT(?ctimage) AS ?imageCount)
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  ?ctimage rdf:type dcm:Image .
  ?ctimage dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?ctimage dcm:KVP ?kvp .
  ?ctimage dcm:ExposureTime ?exposureTime .
  FILTER(xsd:float(?kvp) >= 100 && xsd:float(?kvp) <= 140)
  BIND(
    IF(xsd:float(?exposureTime) < 500, "Short",
      IF(xsd:float(?exposureTime) < 1000, "Medium",
        "Long")) AS ?exposureTimeRange
  )
}
GROUP BY ?exposureTimeRange
ORDER BY ?exposureTimeRange

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all CT images with specific X-ray tube current ranges and count them by exposure ranges.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?exposureRange (COUNT(?ctimage) AS ?imageCount)
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  ?ctimage rdf:type dcm:Image .
  ?ctimage dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?ctimage dcm:XRayTubeCurrent ?xRayTubeCurrent .
  ?ctimage dcm:Exposure ?exposure .
  FILTER(xsd:float(?xRayTubeCurrent) >= 100 && xsd:float(?xRayTubeCurrent) <= 300)
  BIND(
    IF(xsd:float(?exposure) < 100, "Low",
      IF(xsd:float(?exposure) < 200, "Medium",
        "High")) AS ?exposureRange
  )
}
GROUP BY ?exposureRange
ORDER BY ?exposureRange

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all CT images with specific filter type values and count them by convolution kernel values.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?convolutionKernelCategory (COUNT(?ctimage) AS ?imageCount)
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  ?ctimage rdf:type dcm:Image .
  ?ctimage dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?ctimage dcm:FilterType ?filterType .
  ?ctimage dcm:ConvolutionKernel ?convolutionKernel .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(LCASE(?filterType), "body"))
  BIND(
    IF(CONTAINS(LCASE(?convolutionKernel), "soft"), "Soft Tissue",
      IF(CONTAINS(LCASE(?convolutionKernel), "bone"), "Bone",
        IF(CONTAINS(LCASE(?convolutionKernel), "lung"), "Lung",
          "Other"))) AS ?convolutionKernelCategory
  )
}
GROUP BY ?convolutionKernelCategory
ORDER BY ?convolutionKernelCategory

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all CT images with specific revolution time ranges and count them by spiral pitch factor ranges.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?spiralPitchFactorRange (COUNT(?ctimage) AS ?imageCount)
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  ?ctimage rdf:type dcm:Image .
  ?ctimage dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?ctimage dcm:RevolutionTime ?revolutionTime .
  ?ctimage dcm:SpiralPitchFactor ?spiralPitchFactor .
  FILTER(xsd:float(?revolutionTime) < 1)
  BIND(
    IF(xsd:float(?spiralPitchFactor) < 1, "Low",
      IF(xsd:float(?spiralPitchFactor) < 1.5, "Medium",
        "High")) AS ?spiralPitchFactorRange
  )
}
GROUP BY ?spiralPitchFactorRange
ORDER BY ?spiralPitchFactorRange

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all CT images with specific data collection diameter ranges and calculate the average reconstruction diameter.

PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  ?ctimage rdf:type dcm:Image .
  ?ctimage dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?ctimage dcm:DataCollectionDiameter ?dataCollectionDiameter .
  ?ctimage dcm:ReconstructionDiameter ?reconstructionDiameter .
  BIND(
    IF(xsd:float(?dataCollectionDiameter) < 400, "Small",
      IF(xsd:float(?dataCollectionDiameter) < 500, "Medium",
        "Large")) AS ?dataCollectionDiameterRange
  )
}
GROUP BY ?dataCollectionDiameterRange
ORDER BY ?dataCollectionDiameterRange

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all patients who have had both chest and abdomen CT studies.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT DISTINCT ?patient ?patientName
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .

  ?study1 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?series1 dcm:isSeriesOf ?study1 .
  ?series1 dcm:Modality "CT" .
  ?series1 dcm:BodyPartExamined ?bodyPart1 .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(LCASE(?bodyPart1), "chest") || CONTAINS(LCASE(?bodyPart1), "thorax"))
  ?study2 dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?series2 dcm:isSeriesOf ?study2 .
  ?series2 dcm:Modality "CT" .
  ?series2 dcm:BodyPartExamined ?bodyPart2 .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(LCASE(?bodyPart2), "abdomen"))
}
ORDER BY ?patientName

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all series related to studies performed in the morning for elderly patients.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?series ?seriesDescription ?modality ?studyTime ?patientsAge
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyTime ?studyTime .
  ?study dcm:PatientsAge ?patientsAge .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?series dcm:SeriesDescription ?seriesDescription .
  ?series dcm:Modality ?modality .
  FILTER(
    xsd:time(?studyTime) >= xsd:time("08:00:00") && 
    xsd:time(?studyTime) < xsd:time("12:00:00") && 
    xsd:integer(REPLACE(?patientsAge, "Y", "")) >= 65
  )
}
ORDER BY ?studyTime

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all images related to series performed on weekends and their patient information.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?image ?instanceNumber ?seriesDate ?patientName
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?study dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?series dcm:SeriesDate ?seriesDate .
  ?image dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?image dcm:InstanceNumber ?instanceNumber .
  BIND(WEEKDAY(xsd:date(?seriesDate)) AS ?dayOfWeek)
  FILTER(?dayOfWeek = 5 || ?dayOfWeek = 6)  # 5 is Saturday, 6 is Sunday in WEEKDAY function
}
ORDER BY ?seriesDate ?instanceNumber

  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?patient dcm:PatientSex "M" .
  ?study dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?study dcm:ReferringPhysicianName ?referringPhysician .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?series dcm:SeriesDescription ?seriesDescription .
  ?series dcm:Modality ?modality .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(?referringPhysician, "Smith"))
}
ORDER BY ?patientName ?modality

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all images related to series with specific body part examined values and their patient age information.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?image ?instanceNumber ?bodyPartExamined ?patientsAge
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:PatientsAge ?patientsAge .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?series dcm:BodyPartExamined ?bodyPartExamined .
  ?image dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?image dcm:InstanceNumber ?instanceNumber .
  FILTER(CONTAINS(LCASE(?bodyPartExamined), "chest") || CONTAINS(LCASE(?bodyPartExamined), "thorax"))
}
ORDER BY ?patientsAge ?instanceNumber

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all CT images with specific window settings and their series and study information.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?image ?windowCenter ?windowWidth ?seriesDescription ?studyDescription
WHERE {
  ?study rdf:type dcm:Study .
  ?study dcm:StudyDescription ?studyDescription .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?series dcm:Modality "CT" .
  ?series dcm:SeriesDescription ?seriesDescription .
  ?image dcm:isImageOf ?series .
  ?image dcm:WindowCenter ?windowCenter .
  ?image dcm:WindowWidth ?windowWidth .
  FILTER(
    xsd:float(?windowCenter) >= 30 && xsd:float(?windowCenter) <= 50 && 
    xsd:float(?windowWidth) >= 80 && xsd:float(?windowWidth) <= 120
  )
}
ORDER BY ?seriesDescription

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Find all series related to studies performed in specific date ranges and their patient demographic information.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?series ?seriesDescription ?modality ?patientName ?patientSex ?patientsAge
WHERE {
  ?patient rdf:type dcm:Patient .
  ?patient dcm:PatientName ?patientName .
  ?patient dcm:PatientSex ?patientSex .
  ?study dcm:isStudyOf ?patient .
  ?study dcm:StudyDate ?studyDate .
  ?study dcm:PatientsAge ?patientsAge .
  ?series dcm:isSeriesOf ?study .
  ?series dcm:SeriesDescription ?seriesDescription .
  ?series dcm:Modality ?modality .
  FILTER(
    xsd:date(?studyDate) >= xsd:date("2023-01-01") && 
    xsd:date(?studyDate) <= xsd:date("2023-03-31")
  )
}
ORDER BY ?studyDate ?patientName

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Which series have images with KVP values greater than 89?
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT DISTINCT ?series ?modality
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:Modality ?modality .
  ?series dcm:containsImage ?image .
  ?image dcm:KVP ?kvp .
  FILTER(xsd:float(?kvp) > 89)
}

instruction: Read this Natural Language Query very carefully and convert this into valid SPARQL Query
question: Show me the average pixel spacing for each image type.
sparql:
PREFIX dcm: <http://semantic-dicom.org/dcm#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
SELECT ?seriesType (AVG(xsd:float(STRBEFORE(?pixelSpacing, "\\"))) AS ?avgPixelSpacing)
WHERE {
  ?series rdf:type dcm:Series .
  ?series dcm:SeriesType ?seriesType .
  ?series dcm:containsImage ?image .
  ?image dcm:PixelSpacing ?pixelSpacing .
}
GROUP BY ?seriesType
